name: Sofitel Mumbai BKC

reviews.text: Stayed at Sofitel Mumbai BKC for 5 nights for a conference. Overall stay was pleasant. Positives: Staff were eager to please, lobby and building itself are beautiful ( a mix of French and Indian at the same time). The vegetarian restaurant Tuskers was outstanding and the service from the manager was really second to none- perhaps the best I have ever seen in a restaurant. Rooms are nicely appointed with huge bathrooms and large windows. Location is great for business travelers and its about 10 min for the airport. Pool is great as is the spa. Negatives- the staff is very young probably average age is 25 and it shows. I dont think in 5 days I saw anyone with any "grey hair" working in the lobby so I think some issues are simply maturity. Service in the main restaurant is hit or miss and the business center was a disaster. Staff are apologetic but for a business hotel you need results not excuses. Many requests have to be made twice or thrice- this should not happen at $250 a night in India. Overall though a good stay.
reviews.title: Overall a good experience....

reviews.text: I stayed at the Mumbai Sofitel BKC for three nights while attending a conference nearby. From the moment I worked through the door I knew it was going to be a pleasant stay. The key, of course, is the staff. I was greeted at every point by helpful and professional hotel staff who clearly wanted to help. The room was superb. I stayed on floor 9 and had a very comfortable three nights. Free wifi in the room was an unexpected bonus. I have, sadly, become used to being 'gouged' by 5 star hotels with wifi charges which I have always resented. The ability to log on to wifi is now something we all take for granted so for a hotel to recognize and allow for it is a breath of fresh air. Another point, small but welcome, was the safe in the room large enough so that I could put my laptop in.
reviews.title: Best Sofitel so far!

reviews.text: This excellent hotel offers a very soft landing, and access to the airport and the city. We stayed here twice in 3 weeks - at the beginning and at the end of our trip. On the second time we were on the 14th floor with access to the private lounge. Unlike many hotels, this hotel's private lounge is fantastic and well worth it. We really look forward to staying here again.

description: A glistening beacon of sophistication, grandeur and French art de recevoir, Sofitel Mumbai BKC exudes modern luxe, offering unrivaled facilities and a premium address. French culture, design and gastronomy blend artistically with rich Indian tradition in Neo Art Nouveau style offering multifaceted experiences in cuisine, entertainment and relaxation - from flexible, cutting edge meeting space and Club Millesime to the enchanting So SPA and pool side facilities. Where buoyant business meets elegant lifestyle and where "Life is Magnifique". Strategically located in the geographical heart of Mumbai and the new financial and commercial district of the city - Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC), the hotel offers easy access to both the international and domestic terminals of Mumbai’s Chhatrapati International Airport, to South and North Mumbai, the Eastern and Western Express Highways and most of the main tourist attractions in the city.
